verses.verse: "How <S%H4100><s%> beautiful <S%H3302><s%> are your feet <S%H6471><s%> in sandals, <S%H5275><s%> O prince's daughter! <S%H1323><s%> The curves <S%H2542><s%> of your hips <S%H3409><s%> are like <S%H3644><s%> jewels, <S%H2481><s%> The work <S%H4639><s%> of the hands <S%H3027><s%> of an artist. <S%H542><s%>

"Your navel <S%H8270><s%> is [like] a round <S%H5469><s%> goblet <S%H101><s%> Which never <S%H408><s%> lacks <S%H2637><s%> mixed <S%H4197><s%> wine; <S%H4197><s%> Your belly <S%H990><s%> is like a heap <S%H6194><s%> of wheat <S%H2406><s%> Fenced <S%H5473><s%> about <S%H5473><s%> with lilies. <S%H7799><s%>
"Your two <S%H8147><s%> breasts <S%H7699><s%> are like two <S%H8147><s%> fawns, <S%H6082><s%> Twins <S%H9639><s%> of a gazelle. <S%H6646><s%>

"Your neck <S%H6677><s%> is like a tower <S%H4026><s%> of ivory, <S%H8127><s%> Your eyes <S%H5869><s%> [like] the pools <S%H1295><s%> in Heshbon <S%H2809><s%> By the gate <S%H8179><s%> of Bath-rabbim; Your nose <S%H639><s%> is like the tower <S%H4026><s%> of Lebanon, <S%H3844><s%> Which faces <S%H6440><s%> toward <S%H6440><s%> Damascus. <S%H1834><s%>

"Your head <S%H7218><s%> crowns <S%H5921><s%> you like Carmel, <S%H3760><s%> And the flowing <S%H9089><s%> locks <S%H9089><s%> of your head <S%H7218><s%> are like purple <S%H713><s%> threads; <S%H713><s%> [The] king <S%H4428><s%> is captivated <S%H631><s%> by [your] tresses. <S%H9547><s%>
"How <S%H4100><s%> beautiful <S%H3302><s%> and how <S%H4100><s%> delightful <S%H5276><s%> you are, [My] love, <S%H160><s%> with [all] your charms! <S%H8588><s%>
"Your stature <S%H6967><s%> is like <S%H1819><s%> a palm <S%H8558><s%> tree, <S%H8558><s%> And your breasts <S%H7699><s%> are [like its] clusters. <S%H811><s%>

"I said, <S%H559><s%> 'I will climb <S%H5927><s%> the palm <S%H8558><s%> tree, <S%H8558><s%> I will take <S%H270><s%> hold <S%H270><s%> of its fruit <S%H5577><s%> stalks. <S%H5577><s%>' Oh, <S%H4994><s%> may <S%H4994><s%> your breasts <S%H7699><s%> be like clusters <S%H811><s%> of the vine, <S%H1612><s%> And the fragrance <S%H7381><s%> of your breath <S%H639><s%> like apples, <S%H8598><s%>

And your mouth <S%H2441><s%> like the best <S%H2896><s%> wine! <S%H3196><s%>" "It goes <S%H1980><s%> [down] smoothly <S%H4339><s%> for my beloved, <S%H1730><s%> Flowing <S%H1680><s%> gently <S%H1680><s%> [through] the lips <S%H8193><s%> of those who <S%H3463><s%> fall <S%H3463><s%> asleep. <S%H3463><s%>
"I am my beloved's, And his desire <S%H8669><s%> is for me.
"Come, <S%H1980><s%> my beloved, <S%H1730><s%> let us go <S%H3318><s%> out into the country, <S%H7704><s%> Let us spend <S%H3885><s%> the night <S%H3885><s%> in the villages. <S%H3723><s%>

"Let us rise <S%H7925><s%> early <S%H7925><s%> [and go] to the vineyards; <S%H3754><s%> Let us see <S%H7200><s%> whether <S%H518><s%> the vine <S%H1612><s%> has budded <S%H6524><s%> [And its] blossoms <S%H5563><s%> have opened, <S%H6605><s%> [And whether] the pomegranates <S%H7416><s%> have bloomed. <S%H9343><s%> There <S%H8033><s%> I will give <S%H5414><s%> you my love. <S%H1730><s%>

"The mandrakes <S%H1736><s%> have given <S%H5414><s%> forth fragrance; <S%H7381><s%> And over <S%H5921><s%> our doors <S%H6607><s%> are all <S%H3605><s%> choice <S%H4022><s%> [fruits,] Both new <S%H2319><s%> and old, <S%H3465><s%> Which I have saved <S%H6845><s%> up for you, my beloved. <S%H1730><s%>
